chat.title: Suggestions
chat.message:
It is really important that this orderset clarify that the workup and treatment for acute vaginal bleeding is different if pregnant versus not pregnant. 
For example: if this is a first trimester pregnancy loss (miscarriage) tranexamic acid should not be given. Neither should estrogen or progesterone. I have seen TXA given to many people with pregnancy loss. I think we'll have to do some work to make that clear. 
Contraindications to estrogen should be listed before giving estrogen or OCP (active VTE, malignany, migrane with aurora, etc). 
If have containdications to estrogen can give medroxyprogesterone 20mg PO bid. 
Other treatment modalities for acute (non pregnancy related) vaginal bleeding include: Oral contraceptive, 2 pills per day (total 35mcg estrogren) x5 days, then 1 pill per day.
